location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 330: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to Commodore John Patterson Porter, Commander of the Indian Naval Squadron in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: Samuel Hennell acknowledges the receipt of John Patterson Porter's recent letter (see the previous item in this file) and expresses his approval of Lieutenant Frederick Erskine Manners's actions at Kateef [Al-Qaṭīf], stating that the surrender of the plundered property by the Kateef Government can be attributed solely to Manners's judgement and firmness. However, Hennell goes on to say that the Tigrisshould not return to Kateef at this point, adding that he will make a final decision on the matter once he has received expected letters from Bahrein [Bahrain].
